job_title: Clinical Extern (Student Nurse) in Midland, ON
pros: SO many learning opportunities and great staff
cons: Pay compared to psw was quite low even though we did similar work

pros: - Mostly new leaders who take an active interest in staff - teamwork is real - people are passionate about what they do - most colleagues are friendly -
cons: - some team members are very negative - continue to have vacancies (like most hospitals)
Busy work load but that’s normal for a hospital during the pandemic

pros: Well rounded clinical experience, diverse medical/surgical patients
cons: Disorganized, unsafe, caddy, the worst management team experienced to this day, worst team morale, worst workload, part time schedules are unpredictable and last minute

pros:
• Excellent experience if you are just starting out as a new grad, seems to support new graduates well
• Minor procedure hospital
• Small town hospital, mostly friendly staff
cons:
• Very few units to move around to
• If you are an RN, there is lots of opportunity. RPN’s seem to be limited for other available opportunities.
• Currently, if your part time RPN - you’ll be working 3 weekends every month.
• Scheduling seems to be all over the place, very disorganized - known issue, and never seems it will be solved. 
• Management bullying
• Lots of nursing burn out and turn over

pros:
Helpful friendly coworkers
Good support from all units
cons: Staffing issues as with every hospital. Smaller hospital, limited resources

pros: Short commute if you live in town
cons:
The senior leadership is neglectful bordering on criminally negligent
Managers regularly ignore feedback
Pass the buck attitude
Toxic culture, no acknowledgment or appreciation for work

pros:
The management has changed a lot in the last few years and for the better! Great teamwork, lots of great mentors in all units! It's easy to get to know most of the people working in the hospital which I think is nice. 
Lots of education is put out all the time. 
Policies and procedures are always updated and available. 
I would recommend applying and trying it out! Its a level 3 hospital but because its so small we just don't have enough resources so we do tend to send out a lot of patients but also get to keep a decent amount of cool cases! 
The doctors are pretty good to work with!
cons: Some units are short staffed, but they are trying their best to recruit in different ways now such as internet postings, fairs and radio advertisements.

pros: great employees who are lots of fun to work with. everyone is super nice including the owners and the food we sell is pretty decent
cons: the management isn't too great and the food is way too over priced. there aren't proper washroom facilities only porta potties
